items.content:
Lead, JavaScript Engineer in Test at Elastic.co

Remote | International

Location: Distributed, Global

Elastic is a search company with a simple goal: to solve the world’s data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the creators of the Elastic Stack, we help thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, Verizon, and many more use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what’s possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We have a distributed team of Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting), and our diverse open sourcecommunity spans over 100 countries. Learn more at elastic.co

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world’s data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what’s possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting!), 18 timezones, and 30 different languages into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

What is Elastic Code?

Elastic Code is a IDE-like semantic code search solution built on top of the Elastic Stack. It helps development teams to search, navigate and collaborate on large code bases more efficiently. Known previously as insight.io, the product has been used and loved by tens of thousands of developers and received 5 star review on chrome store. YOU will be a founding member of Elastic Code team and a shaper of the Elastic Code product.

What You’ll be Doing:

  • Join Elastic Code team to assure the quality of Code app in Elastic stack
  • Work with the development team to plan the test cases for releases
  • Report and verify bugs in a timely manner
  • Ability to identify and research issues with our products
  • Develop automated functional tests and stress tests
  • Manage and improve our CI system on Jenkins

What You’ll Bring:

  • Significant knowledge of JavaScript.
  • You have strong test automation programming skills using some of the following: Selenium, Javascript, Python, Pytest.
  • You are experienced working in Git or other source code management systems
  • You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • You thrive in a team oriented environment with strong analytical, problem solving, debugging, and troubleshooting skills
  • You love working with web technologies and related stack
  • You are well versed in web services paradigms such as REST and protocols such as HTTP
  • You have knowledge of UNIX/Linux environments and shell scripting

Bonus Skills:

  • Familiarity with various build systems such as NPM, Gradle, Maven, Ant etc.
  • Experience in Docker
  • Experienced in performance and load testing of web services
  • Experience with Elastic Stack

#LI-DA1

Additional Information – We Take Care of Our People

At Elastic, we strive to have parity of benefits across regions. While regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of people is the right thing to do.

  • Health coverage for you and your family.
  • Flexible location and schedule for many roles.
  • Generous number of vacation days each year.
  • Double your charitable giving — we match up to 1% of your salary.
  • Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

s consistent with applicable law.

items.content:
QA Engineer at Heetch

Remote | International

PARIS

ENGINEERING – QA

PERMANENT EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT

Read before applying:

We’re a young company iterating over our remote culture so for now, we’re only working with people in locations where the time zone is:

-3 hours > Paris time zone < +3 hours

You will join one of our most user-centric product teams which top priority is the happiness of our passengers and drivers.

Whether they use our product from time to time to move around or every single day as a professional tool, you’ll make sure they get the stellar experience they deserve.

Given our very large business scope (users acquisition, retention and well-being), our teams are working side by side with internal partners (Ops, Marketing, Design, Engineering), allowing us to build features that will make our users enjoy being on our platform.

With the many new challenges we’re facing every day, our team is seeking a product aficionado that will help us take our services to the next level. Our ideal candidate is someone who loves building software people genuinely love using, have strong problem-solving skills and great empathy for users.

Team Values

  • Transparency: We discuss everything openly within the team. Our speak up culture is strong.
  • Remote first: Our team is fully distributed, and we work hard at that, but feel free to work from any of our offices in Paris, London, Stockholm, Milan, Bruxelles or Casablanca.
  • The courage to fail: We celebrate the wins, but more importantly we’re not afraid to fail, we always learn and go again.
  • Team Unity: No one is left behind.
  • Code quality: It’s not software without tests.

Team Life

  • Work wherever you want: we’ve always been remote first but also have offices in Paris, London, Bruxelles, and Casablanca.
  • Open communication: everything is public within the team.
  • You are not alone: we are supportive of each other and use Slack and video calls to keep in touch.
  • Promulgate Knowledge: whether it’s organizational, cultural or technical, we’re eager to learn!
  • Continuous improvement: weekly team retrospective and strong Speak Up value.

What will you do?

  • Make sure everything we release is rock-solid and performant.
  • Propose, define and implement processes and standards for test automation.
  • Perform functional testing of new features as they are developed, using automation when and where it makes sense.
  • Write code.
  • Reproduce bugs reported by customers or caught by our internal monitoring.
  • Provide detailed documentation, presentations and training on automation framework/tools/tests developed.
  • Establish and track the quality metrics, KPIs and reports.

Does it sound like you?

  • Demonstrated experience in test planning, test design, test strategy, and test execution of highly complex systems.
  • Experience working closely with development and business teams to communicate problem impacts and to understand business requirements.
  • Ability to design and plan testing conditions, test scripts, and test data sets to ensure appropriate and adequate coverage and control.
  • Strong understanding of QA methodologies, tools, efficient testing strategies, and modern best practices.
  • Ability to write quality code in at least one high level programming language.
  • Experience in test automation.
  • Excellent understanding of software development life cycle (CI/CD).
  • 5+ years of experience as QA Engineer for mobile or backend.
  • Fluent in English.

Bonus points

  • You are famous among your peers for your ability to break software in unexpected ways.
  • Exposure to Docker, Golang, Ruby or Elixir.

What’s next?

If your application is selected, the process will be composed of 4 steps:

  1.  Non technical interview with the Engineering Manager of your potential team (1h30)
  2.  Take home assignment (~5 days deadline)
  3.  Interview with your future teammates (1h)
  4.  Day on site (Paris) to meet your future stakeholders
Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Interpreter Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Cloud Computing, Data Science, Software Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Luna | Kraków, Poland

Remote details

Office Location: Kraków, Poland. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

java
scala
truffle
jvm
graalvm

Job description

Senior Interpreter Engineer
Luna is looking for a senior interpreter engineer to help build the next generation interpreter and runtime for Luna, a project said by Singularity University to have the potential to change the lives of one-billion people. If you have strong technical skills and a passion for all things interpreter, then this role could be the one for you.

As an interpreter engineer you'll work as part of the compiler team to design and implement the new Luna interpreter and runtime, work that is at the very core of the next phase of Luna's development. You'll have the opportunity to collaborate with a world-class team of engineers, community managers, and business developers (with experience at Bloomberg, GitHub, and PayPal, to name a few), and make your indelible mark on the future of Luna.

What You'll Do
As a senior interpreter developer, you'll be working on the design and development of the new Luna interpreter and runtime, to help support the Language's evolution. This will involve:

  • Working to design and implement the new Luna interpreter, including the optimiser, real-time introspection capabilities, and foreign-language interoperability.
  • Practical work improving the performance of the interpreter and the code that it executes by diagnosing performance issues and implementing improvements.
  • Practical work implementing front-end optimisations for Luna that improve the code that is executed by the interpreter.
  • Working on and improving the introspection capabilities that allow external programs to inspect and modify the interpreter's state (including support for debugging).

The Skills We're Looking For
We have a few particular skills that we're looking for in this role:

  • Practical and rich experience writing code in either Scala or Java (3+ years).
  • Experience building an interpreter for a programming language.
  • A deep understanding of the JVM, its execution model, and garbage collection behaviours, born of practical experience.
  • Experience using the JVM's profiling and debugging tools to solve problems on large-scale projects.
  • Practical experience building large and complex software systems, as well as in their ongoing evolution and maintenance.

It would be a big bonus if you had:

  • Experience with GraalVM and the Truffle framework for programming language development.
  • Experience using purely functional programming languages, such as Haskell.
  • Experience employing type-level programming techniques in functional programming languages.

Avoid the confidence gap. You don't have to match all of the skills above to apply!

Who You'll Work With
You'll be joining a distributed, multi-disciplinary team that includes people with skills spanning from compiler development to data-science. Though you'll have your area to work on, our internal culture is one of collaboration and communication, and input is always welcomed.

We firmly believe that only by working together, rather than putting our team members in their own boxes, can we create the best version of Luna that can be.

The Details
As part of the Luna team you'd be able to work from anywhere, whether that be at home, or on the go! We have team members distributed across the world, from San Francisco, to London, to Kraków. We welcome remote work and flexible schedules, or you can work from the Kraków office (or our planned SF office) if you'd like. We can provide competitive compensation and holiday, as well as the possibility
of equity as time goes on.

How To Apply?
Send us an email at jobs@luna-lang.org, and tell us a little bit about yourself and why you think you'd be a good fit for the role! You can also tell us about:

  • Some of your past work or projects.
  • Why you'd like to work on Luna, and where you imagine Luna being in 5 years.
  • The most important features of a team that you'd like to work in.
  • Whether you take pride in your ability to communicate clearly and efficiently with your team.
Apply now

About Luna

About Luna
Luna is an award-winning general-purpose programming language and data-science platform, selected by NASA and Singularity University as a technology with the potential to impact the lives of one-billion people worldwide. It spans the entire stack, from high-level visualisation and communication, to the
nitty-gritty of running backend services in a single language. With inbuilt capabilities for visualisation and a dual-syntax architecture, the possibilities are limitless.

At Luna, we have a world-class team, with developers, community managers, and business developers from all walks of life and backgrounds, and work in close collaboration with industry advisers such as Robert Gentleman, the creator of the R programming language and computational biologist at 23andMe, and Edward Kmett, a skilled language designer and machine intelligence researcher at MIRI.

We welcome anybody to our team, as long as you have the desire and drive to see Luna succeed.

Benefits

  • Team built around the Humility, Respect, and Trust ideology.
  • Flexible working hours, possible part / full time remote work.
  • Work in a small team of world-class engineers and make impact on Luna.
  • Competitive compensation + possibility of equity as time goes on.
  • Equality, diversity & inclusion.
  • We've got standing desks in our office (no one uses them though :P).

Job description

Minimum Required Skills: Test Automation, Strong Selenium, experience with Maven and Java

Location: 100% Remote

As a leading software development consultancy, Clevertech is building transformative enterprise solutions that are affecting millions of people and/or millions of dollars, while creating opportunities for growth for our developers.

We are seeking strong QA Automation Engineer with excellent communication skills to ensure our coding standards are maintained in code testing code. Experience with TestNG, Selenium, Maven and SureFire required.

There will be a 45-minute online technical test including Java, Selenium and Maven to advance.

Who You Are:

  • You are an experienced engineer with 2-5 years of Java Automation Testing
  • You can communicate clearly and precisely with developers and clients
  • You love to create tests that ensure the code is reliable

Qualifications:

Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Benefits

items.title: Quality Assurance Specialist
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Quality Assurance Specialist at ClickFunnels

Remote

Boise, Idaho, United States

Full-time Allows remote

ClickFunnels is a company focused on changing the world by helping individuals and businesses get their message, products and services out to those they want to serve. We created an amazing software platform to make this process as simple and friendly as possible. We work hard to serve our customers at the highest possible level by providing the tools and knowledge they need to be successful. We believe that what we do matters and we are looking for people to help us in our cause.

With over 90,000 users, a growing internal team, and a passion for being the best we can be, we are looking for a QA Specialist to help us continue to grow and scale our business.

At ClickFunnels, QA Specialists are not only expected to be masters of the application, but knowledgeable in areas of the application that are brittle or fragile due to various reasons, such as technical debt, rapid prototyping, etc. Also, QA Specialists should have an understanding of how customers use the application, not just the “intended functionality.” QA Specialists are the final check on a code change before it goes live.

In this role you’ll make an impact by….

  • Maintaining a deep understanding of the ClickFunnels application, including the mobile application, different programs offered by ClickFunnels, a general understanding of 3rd party integrations, and the use of our monitoring applications
  • Manually testing every pull request to validate that the change made by the developer works as intended
  • Performing positive/negative testing, where applicable, within every pull request
  • Smoke testing every pull request in a review app/staging to check for regression
  • Documenting issues discovered during feature sprints
  • Prior to a feature being turned on for users, performing a full regression test on a subset of features to make sure it is ready for public consumption
  • Performing ad-hoc exploratory testing of the application
  • Providing feedback to Product Management, Developers, Design, and/or Security about any concerns discovered during testing
  • Designing, developing and maintaining test cases and strategies to be added to the automated test software
  • Participating in the post-mortem process for all large-scale incidents
  • Assisting in the creation of standard operating procedures within the QA department
  • Actively engaging in monthly team retrospective meetings (at both the product team and team discipline levels)
  • Helping other teams/departments where applicable

We are looking for individuals with….

  • 2 years experience with web application testing
  • A firm understanding of testing concepts such as positive/negative and exploratory testing
  • Familiarity with the product lifecycle and how each department within the Product Development organization contributes to the lifecycle
  • Ability to think critically and problem-solve independently, but also work together as a team when necessary

We’ll see it a bonus if you also have….

  • Experience using Heroku/GitHub
  • Experience building test cases

Position can be remote, however hiring is limited to the following states in the United States.

  • Arizona
  • California
  • Colorado
  • Connecticut
  • Florida
  • Georgia
  • Idaho
  • Indiana
  • Kansas
  • Maryland
  • Massachusetts
  • Michigan
  • Minnesota
  • Missouri
  • Nevada
  • North Carolina
  • Oklahoma
  • South Carolina
  • Tennessee
  • Texas
  • Utah
  • Virginia
  • Washington

ClickFunnels is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Apply for job

Software Development Engineer in Test (Automation)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Personal Finance
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Wallethub | No office location

Technologies

java
selenium
automated-tests
automation

Job description

Company details

WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the US and rapidly growing. We’re looking for a motivated, hardworking, and competitive Software Development Engineer in Test (Automation) for a full-time, permanent position.

Responsibilities

  • Testing and assuring high quality performance of website
  • Writing clear and maintainable high-quality Java code
  • Reporting and validating bugs for all components
  • Creating test plans and test cases
  • Creating and maintaining automated tests using Selenium and Java
  • Identifying opportunities for improvement and making constructive suggestions for change
  • Staying up-to-date with developing technologies and showcasing them in your work

Qualifications

You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:

  • At least 5 years hands-on experience in Test Automation with Java and Selenium
  • At least 2 years experience in development
  • Excellent attention to details
  • Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Willingness to work hard
  • Proficient in written/spoken English

Compensation

  • Very competitive salary based on prior experience and qualifications
  • Potential for stock options after the first year
  • Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations
  • The ability to work overtime for added income
  • 100% remote position
  • Visa sponsorship (after 24 months with the company, based on performance in case you will be working from outside the US)

Notes 

  • This position entails workingat least 55 hours per week and requires an overlap with EST business hours (7am - 7pm ET, including 1 hour break).
  • Although we appreciate your interest in working with us, due to the high number of applications, we will not be able to reply to candidates who have not been selected to move forward.
Apply now

About Wallethub

WalletHub helps all consumers reach top financial fitness by providing:

• Free credit scores and credit reports that are updated on a daily basis.

• Free 24/7 credit monitoring and personalized advice that will help you improve your credit and save money.

• More reviews on financial products, professionals and companies than any other website.

• An extensive education center coupled with the ability to ask financial experts your money-related questions for free .

Benefits

  • Stock options
  • Health benefits
  • Work visa sponsorship
  • Competitive salary
  • Work from home

items.title: Revenue Assurance Senior Accountant
items.content:
Revenue Assurance Senior Accountant at Rosetta Stone

Remote
  • USA, Remote
  • Full Time
  • JR102863

We Are Financial Services

We make numbers count. Our strategic advice helps our global organization make extensive use of data, statistical and qualitative analysis, ruled-based methods, and explanatory and predictive modeling to bring key insight to client issues. We support the finance organization and provide specialized services to the company’s business leadership. Does joining our team add up for you?

You Are a Revenue Assurance Senior Accountant

  • Support accounting for all North America Revenues including Enterprise and Education, Retail and Direct to Consumer sales channels. Includes revenue from software, subscription services and bundled software and subscription service products.
  • Account for and track special revenue arrangements.
  • Perform month-end and quarter-end close activities, including journal entries, accruals, and reconciliations
  • Perform ongoing internal controls and reviews of revenue recognition.
  • Participate in review of both Enterprise & Education and Consumer sales contracts and credit memos.
  • Reviewing and processing adjustments to returns reporting.
  • Monitor and review system transaction processing to detect/address errors as necessary.
  • Responsible for inventory item coding to Revenue GL accounts.
  • Participate in SEC reporting process and internal management reporting, as necessary.
  • Coordinate with external auditors, as necessary.
  • Ensure SOX controls are properly performed and documented.
  • Reports to Manager – Revenue Assurance.

Initiative: Identify opportunities for streamlining processes. Strive to be proactive with learning higher level functions within the group.

Accountability: Completeness and accuracy of work while ensuring proper application of GAAP.

Adaptability: Ability to function well in a fast paced, dynamic environment while having the ability to manage competing priorities.

Collaboration: Develop and maintain working relationships with members of FP&A, Financial Reporting, Accounts Receivable, Order Management and other groups as necessary.

All About You

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting from an accredited university.
  • Strong understanding of U.S. GAAP and SEC regulations.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
  • 3-4 years of accounting experience in Public Accounting or public company experience
  • 3-4 years of experience with revenue recognition, with preference for software revenue recognition, multiple element arrangements, gross vs net revenue policies for resellers, and accounting for rebates and customer incentives/payments preferred.
  • CPA license or working towards CPA license preferred.
  • Ability to build strong working relationships across the organization.
  • Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel.
  • Oracle ERP system knowledge a plus.
  • Solid organizational and analytical skills.
Apply for job

items.content:
Preferred candidate who can sit in Nashville, TN (Remote position) but open for Remote for right candidate

Healthcare experience is BIG PLUS

Rate: $50/hr on W2 or $55/hr on C2C

Key Skills: ETL- Informatica Testing , DW testing, SQL queries & Teradata database

MATRIX Resources is seeking ETL Testers for our client in Nashville, TN for a 6-month contract. Our client is a well-respected global consulting company. This is an exciting opportunity to work with a major organization in the healthcare industry.

As an ETL Tester you will be responsible for integration testing of data. This position will require strong SQL skills and the ability to write complex SQL queries.

Responsibilities:

  • Create test cases and test scripts based on requirement and design documents
  • Execute application testing as directed by client (client will train on application)
  • Review other test team members work to further promote quality
  • Collaborate and work with client to log, record and track test metrics; including test cases, tests executed, defect tracking/resolution and others as appropriate
  • Lead and participate in Agile/project management meetings as appropriate for success of project

Required:

This position works with clinicians, developers, and federal staff to review and evaluate software products and systems.

  • Perform test validation at various levels including database validation, logging validation, and user interface validation.
  • Tracks and reports test results, troubleshoots, and coordinates fixes.
  • Inform team leads and other designated management officials of results of testing activities.
  • Document, track, and escalate issues as appropriate, using VSTS to document identified bugs.
  • Participates in troubleshooting and triaging the issues with team members to drive towards root cause identification and resolution.
  • Develops and presents technical documentation, test cases, test reports, test data sets and other briefing materials to support program status reviews, control gates, and other presentations as directed by program management.

  • Work with agile team members to design, develop, enhance, debug and implement a test automation framework.
  • Opportunity to work primarily from home with a geographically dispersed team.
---
  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training or work experience.
  • 5+ years of experience with functional testing, integration testing, system acceptance testing, and user acceptance testing.
  • Agile certification such as Scrum Alliance CSM or Scaled Agile SAFe considered a plus.
---
  • Comprehensive knowledge of the principles, methods, and techniques used in quality assurance and software engineering.
  • Understanding of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) Capability Maturity Model (CMM) and ISO 9001 requirements.
  • Experience with automated testing, a plus.
  • Experience with Health IT, EHR systems, and Meaningful Use, highly desired.
  • Demonstrated relevant work experience in development or testing role.
  • Demonstrated ability to explain technical issues clearly/accurately to technical/non-technical audiences.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a collaborative team with adjusting priorities and deadlines.
  • Understanding of Agile processes and the related QA lifecycle.
  • Working knowledge of Team Foundation Server and/or Azure DevOps a plus.
  • Proven ability to work on a remote/distributed team.
  • Must be able to obtain a Public Trust Level 5 clearance. Active Public Trust or higher clearance, a plus.

Over 40,000 GDIT professionals deliver enterprise solutions, manage mission-critical IT programs and provide mission support services worldwide. GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

items.title: Quality Assurance Engineer
items.content:
Quality Assurance Engineer at Peerfit

Remote
  • Product
  • United States

Not open to recruiting firms. Applicants please apply here. Please do not send resumes directly to any hiring manager.

Due to customer data access requirements, this position must be located in the U.S.

Peerfit

Interested in working for an organization redefining how fitness and health care work together? At Peerfit, we’re streamlining wellness reimbursements and incentivizing healthy lifestyle by connecting insurers’ and employers’ wellness dollars to popular fitness studios offering CrossFit, yoga, barre, boot camp, cycling, and more. If working with a team of innovative and driven people who are modernizing how people engage with wellness excites you, look no further than Peerfit.

Position Summary

As a Quality Engineer you will support the Product department as a member of the Delivery Team bringing both high-touch and automated quality guarantees to applications, integrations, and operations.

You will be joining a passionate team of engineers, designers, and knowledge workers who are building digital product for lifestyle wellness and enterprise health solutions. Your expertise should include development and execution of test plans, comprehensive quality assurance and verification, and automation tooling.

We’re seeking someone who is solution-oriented, pragmatic, and consensus-driven in their approach to rapidly building iterative software to solve real problems in our product and technical domains.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Manual testing
  • Automated testing
  • Test plan and case creation
  • Prepare bug reports including written descriptions, screenshots and videos to demonstrate scenarios
  • Participation in project planning, design process and technical and quality audits
  • Compare project development deliverables to product design documents, mock-ups and flow charts to ensure product meets specifications
  • Post deployment testing, validation and status communication to stakeholders

Experience / Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience as a quality engineer in a web or mobile software environment
  • Strong understanding of Agile software development lifecycle and complementary QA methodologies, tools and processes
  • Able to create and execute comprehensive software test plans
  • Strong understanding and passion for great user experience
  • Understanding of software build environments
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Familiar with multiple operating systems, browsers and mobile devices
  • Broadband Internet access

Nice-To-Haves:

  • Familiarity with third-party software testing and automation tools
  • Familiarity with Pivotal Tracker, Jira or other project tracking tools
  • Familiarity with testing for accessibility and knowledge of WCAG AA standards
  • Experience with fuzz testing, black box testing, and/or other security testing practices / methodologies
  • Experience with performance and benchmark testing

Educational Guidelines:

Bachelor’s degree in an information/comp-sci program or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.

Who We Need: (Intangibles)

  • Passionate about health and fitness
  • Desires to have a role in the growth of a startup
  • Stays motivated and knows how to be persistent
  • Is inquisitive and curious
  • Is self-directed with great problem solving skills
  • Highly organized and able to balance multiple projects and priorities
  • Can work remotely and make decisions autonomously at a high level
  • Flexibility to handle changing responsibilities

What You Get:

  • The opportunity to help expand the impact of Peerfit across the United States…and, someday, the world!
  • The chance to work in a relaxed, yet goal-driven start-up culture with a passion for fitness
  • Peerfit credits to attend fitness classes.
  • Chance to work remotely with flexible scheduling
  • Health insurance & other benefits

Peerfit is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Apply for job

  • At least 2 years experience in development
  • Excellent attention to details
  • Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Willingness to work hard

Compensation

  • Potential for stock options after the first year

Notes

As a leading software development consultancy, Clevertech is building transformative enterprise solutions that are affecting millions of people and/or millions of dollars, while creating opportunities for growth for our developers.

We are seeking strong QA Automation Engineer with excellent communication skills to ensure our coding standards are maintained in code testing code. Experience with TestNG, Selenium, Maven and SureFire required.

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

items.title: Harvest: QA Engineer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
QA Engineer

About Harvest:


Harvest is an independent software company making tools that help teams run smoothly. For the past 13 years, our customers have relied on our products as a valuable part of their day-to-day operations. They’re the reason we’re still in business and we owe it to them to deliver the best and most bug-free products we can.


Harvest started as a team of 3 and grew slowly to today’s current total of just over 55 lovely faces. Though we have an office in NYC, we hire the best people for the job no matter what city they call home. We’ve been working as a remote team since the beginning, and we work hard to make sure everyone feels included and heard.


Additionally, if you are a member of a group that is historically underrepresented and disadvantaged in technology or society, please know that we welcome your application. We want to meet you!


Some Of What You’ll Do:
  • Work directly with the product and development teams to set the direction and specifications for new feature development in our suite of applications.
  • Write and use test cases to check new feature development for bugs or potential customer confusion.
  • Assist in growing our automated testing library via tools like Selenium and Appium.
  • Collaborate with the rest of the QA team to document features, changes, or bugs.
  • Help with escalated support to triage, replicate, and verify fixes for customer-reported bugs.

Our Ideal Candidate:
  • You’re comfortable working on a small team.
  • You’re an excellent communicator with great writing skills.
  • You’re excited at the idea of learning and trying new things.
  • You’ve worked in QA before and have an exceptional eye for detail.
  • You have experience writing and maintaining automated tests.
  • Your working hours are flexible enough to partially overlap with U.S. Eastern time.

When You Apply:
  • Tell us about your prior experience in QA.
  • Show us a hobby or something you take pride in outside of work.
  • Give us a suggestion to improve one of our products (or report a bug!).
  • You could work anywhere, why Harvest?

items.content:
This opportunity can be either 100% remote or has the option to sit in any of the company's offices.
This opportunity has the chance to convert full-time given our realtionship with the client company.
MUST be able to work on W2 WITHOUT sponsorship

A financial technologies company is seeking a Test Automation Engineer contractor for a 100% remote role. This individual will design, develop, and maintain reusable automated test scripts. Adhere to current automation strategies and best practices. Evaluate, review, and test new or modified software programs to verify that programs function according to user requirements and conforms to established guidelines.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in dedicated test automation
  • Experience with Quality Assurance methodologies, development processes and engineering excellence.
  • Experience with C#/.Net.
  • Experience with Visual Studio.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience using MTM and Microsoft's Test Hub
  • Strong knowledge of technologies that enable web systems: JavaScript, HTML, XML, C#, .NET Framework, HTTP, ASP.NET, SOAP, fiddler required, Selenium.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
  • Creates and maintains moderately complex automated scripts. Develops reusable automated scripts from a variety of interfaces.
  • Schedules and performs testing as assigned; submits errors and issues to development for correction, and retests once errors have been corrected; tests corrected code. Tracks defects and causal analysis to closure.
  • Coordinates and monitors moderately complex automation projects from initiation through delivery. Ensures that automation projects are completed on schedule and within budget.
  • Establishes/maintains communication with manual testers/teams to ensure new automation and automation maintenance needs are met in appropriate time frames.
  • Prepares automated test plans and test scripts for software corrections and enhancements. May review test plans and test reports.
  • Uses automated Quality Assurance systems to facilitate daily activities.
  • May maintain test environments/data to be used with test automation.
  • Executes and reports results of automated scripts in test management tools. Presents reporting of automation progress as requested.
  • Analyzes script results and reports issues as requested. Performs code reviews of automated scripts from team members.
  • Provides assistance with running automated tests and training on automation to other teams as requested. Provides technical assistance to other members of the automation team.
  • Understands and debugs scripts developed by team peers.
  • May assist and instruct software developers in designing test cases for unit testing.
  • May assist and instruct in creating use cases for UMLs.
  • May create and maintain test libraries, databases, and test environments.
  • May assist with any software changes for documentation update or correction.
  • May assist with alpha and beta testing; prepares enhancement test plans used at beta site.
  • May assist with the education and training of software enhancements and conveying corrections to other employees.
  • May create or assist with creation of manual tests.
About TEKsystems:
We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call -3411 or email .com for other accommodation options.

items.title: Remote, Salesforce Quality Assurance Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=16, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Salesforce Quality Assurance Analyst, 100% REMOTE

Full Time Employee / Direct Hire

Travel Required: up to 1 week / quarter

The Salesforce Quality Assurance Analyst has a strong background in quality assurance and specialized experience with Salesforce and Salesforce custom objects. They will work closely with our product management, software engineers, and other organization partners to ensure that all released content meets requirements and that we deliver quality products to both internal and external stakeholders. The Salesforce Quality Assurance Analyst is responsible for ensuring that all released code meets the Organization's high-quality standards and ensures software projects are accurately documented and that coded features fulfill the acceptance criteria as outlined. They utilize various testing methods to ensure quality, including black box, white box, regression, and automated testing. The Salesforce Quality Assurance Analyst works with the Product Owners and engineering team to define, achieve, and maintain quality.

This is a unique opportunity for talented individuals to join our team and help strengthen the quality assurance capabilities of one of the fastest growing physician-led medical groups in the nation. This role sits on the Product Engineering Team, a team that has built one of the most integrated care delivery environments in the country. Our platform connects our doctors, our patients, and our care management team, enabling high quality, coordinated care. The Product Engineering Team is responsible for building out the Company's technical capability with new features, functions, and interfaces.
Primary Job Duties:
  • Work with stakeholders, product owners and engineers to understand complex systems and interfaces in order to determine efficient analysis and testing approaches.
  • Writing, executing and maintaining both manual and automated test cases for functional and regression testing which requires translating both simple and complex business rules to easy to understand test cases and ensure that released applications meets agreed-upon requirements and applicable QA standards.
  • Creating and maintaining detailed systems documentation for the Company's Salesforce customizations and developing a core understanding of our Salesforce ecosystem and the business requirements driving them.
  • Manage and report test results which will require clear and concise documentation and an ability to conduct root cause analysis and communicate complex information to both technical and non-technical personnel.
  • Maintaining test sandbox environments to include managing test data, configuring systems for specific test needs, and monitoring issue reports (e.g. bugsnag).
  • Participating in team building and driving QA efforts towards continuous process improvement to include training and mentoring junior staff and offshore resources.
Minimum Qualifications:
  • Minimum 2 years relevant experience
    • Working in web application testing
    • Writing test cases and test plans
    • Writing basic SQL queries
    • Utilizing enterprise-class test management tool
    • Working in a ticketing system
  • Specialized experience with Salesforce testing
  • Must provide accessibility to private, quiet work space with high-speed internet to effectively work remotely
  • Must comply with HIPAA rules and regulations
Interpersonal skills & Attributes:
  • Ability to work in a geographically distributed team
  • Willingness to accept input from anyone on the team
  • Eagerness to learn new skills and frameworks, as necessary
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize
  • Ability to follow and enforce processes
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Preferred background and Skills:
  • Healthcare IT industry experience, especially in electronic health records and related systems
  • Knowledge and experience working with HL7 interfaces
  • API experience
  • Comfortable with command line functions such as connecting to remote servers and tailing or searching log files using basic Unix/Linux commands
  • Experience working in an Agile environment
  • Experience working in a fast-growing organization
  • Automated testing experience (Cucumber, Rspec, others)
  • Working knowledge of JIRA

The Salesforce Quality Assurance Analyst has a strong background in quality assurance and specialized experience with Salesforce and Salesforce custom objects. items.content:
Quality Assurance Engineer at SecurityScorecard

Remote

at SecurityScorecard
Remote

About the Role
SecurityScorecard is growing our team in Prague, and will hire a QA Manager to join the team. The ideal candidate is comfortable making hands-on contributions to testing in addition offering guidance and leadership to a team of three test engineers. The QA Manager will have good understanding of QA lifecycle, software lifecycle methodologies, and experience leading QA Engineers in remote locations. The QA Manager will be well versed in both manual and automated testing and will lead efforts to evolve our testing to fully automated, making recommendations for tools.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and manage QA team of 3 engineers, providing oversight on implementations, schedules and deliverables.
  • Develop, manage and document test strategy and test plans
  • Define and maintain a testing automation framework and continue to build test suites for regression coverage and stabilization.
  • Manage spec reviews and requirement definitions to detect measurable requirements for testing (completeness and accuracy)
  • Design and create test conditions and scripts to address business and technical use cases.
  • Analyze, develop, and execute test data validation strategies to validate reports and data
  • Interact with project managers and development teams to develop a strong understanding of the project and testing objectives.
  • Manage the triage, prioritization, resolution, automation, and delivery of fixes for defects, including production defects
  • Create, edit and update test plans and test cases ensuring use of appropriate test methodology
  • Complete test coverage and full test documentation for all code to be tested
  • Test software releases against requirements / technical design
  • Manually execute test scripts performing false positive and false negative testing.

Experience and Skills:

  • Proficiency designing, developing and executing functional test team deliverables
  • Exceptional project planning and management skills.
  • Experienced in understanding products and processes and break them down into testing components
  • Experience automating performance tests
  • Experience leading a team, managing projects and prioritizing
  • Experience with Java and Javascript

Traits:

  • Critical thinker
  • Perseverant; navigate through ambiguity and challenges
  • Collaborative across functions
  • Relationship builder across functions and levels
Apply for job

items.title: Clinical Quality Management Data Technician
items.content:
Clinical Quality Management Data Technician at UnitedHealth Group

Remote

Location: Minneapolis Minnesota United States
Division:OptumServe Admin
Contest Number: 840836
Family: Analytics
Function: Data Analytics
Business Segment: OptumCare
Region: North America
Country: United States
City: Minneapolis
State: Minnesota
Other States: Connecticut Texas Florida Arizona
Other Cities: Hartford Dallas Tampa Phoenix
Employee Status:Regular
Schedule:Full-time
Job Level:Individual Contributor
Shift:Day Job
Travel:No
Overtime Status:Non-exempt
Telecommuter Position: Yes

Position Description

OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare’s support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians.

This position works under the supervision of the CQM Scientific Studies Manager and will be responsible for the collection and analysis of Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set (HEDIS) – like data from VA CCN providers. This position will be responsible for requesting and entry of HEDIS-like data into an internal database and assure data quality. Responsibilities include the analysis of data, identifying trends/patterns, reporting results and working closely with the CQM Study Analysts to ensure accurate and timely development of corrective action activities to improve health outcomes. This position will be responsible for assisting with the collection of provider performance data (e.g. HEDIS, Hospital Compare and other internal/external data sources), running reports and conducting data analysis to review and monitor provider performance.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Data entry of provider quality and performance outcome template results
  • Triggering follow up provider requests, as appropriate
  • Create comprehensive reporting specification requirements from HEDIS, Hospital Compare and other data sources
  • Perform data analysis associated with the provider monitoring process, identifying trends/patterns and performing opportunities
  • Collaborate with other internal and external stakeholders regarding the provider monitoring process
  • Collaborates with other team members to review and monitor providers to improve the delivery of clinical quality health care
  • Contributes to the creating, reviewing, and revising of internal database
  • Assists with clinical quality studies, including entry of data, data analysis, and medical records abstraction
  • Works with provider quality and performance review, monitoring and improvement activities
  • Analysis of dashboards, data visualizations, and decisions aids to support the department
  • Assist in the development of VA CCN Patient Safety Initiatives based on trends/patterns identified
  • Assists with developing new comprehensive reporting needs for the studies team
  • Provide support to the patient safety team with data reporting and analysis, as needed
  • Maintains confidentiality and non-discoverability of all activities
  • Performs all other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma / GED (or higher)
  • 2+ years data entry experience in healthcare quality related activities
  • Comprehensive knowledge of research methodology, HEDIS measures, benchmarking
  • Strong computer skills with emphasis on Excel, Access, and PowerPoint (ability to create, save, edit and open)
  • Must live in a location that can receive a high speed internet connection using UHG approved Internet Service Provider (ISP) or be within a 2 hour driving distance of a UHG office with hoteling

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate Degree (or higher)

items.content:
Software Development Engineer in Test (mobile) m/f/d

Company: FREE NOW DE
Location: Hamburg, DE
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
QA / Testing
Skills:
  • iOS/Android App Testing
  • OOP

    • Intro

    As of now, we’re looking for a passionate Software Development Engineer in Test m/f/d for our mobile app development in Hamburg HQ office.

     
    These are your responsibilities:
    • Write automation tests for our mobile apps used by millions of users.
    • Plan, scope, schedule and implement testing activities for our project.
    • Understand our business and product, define the quality metrics.
    • Participate in the full agile SDLC, including meetings, iterative development, and estimations.
    • Monitor backend services status, quickly respond to errors.
    • Take care of CI jobs, including release build.
    • Responsible for 2nd level technical support as a team effort, be the key player for the bug process.
    • Plan test sessions.
    • Stay on top of the latest technology trends, apply the best practices to our daily work.
    • Work in a motivated and innovative team with flat hierarchies.

    Main requirements

    • BS in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience.
    • Passionate, proactive, self-motivated individual.
    • Experience in object-oriented software development.
    • Thorough knowledge of Android and/or iOS platforms.
    • 3+ years’ experience testing native Android and/or iOS mobile apps.
    • Exposure to development or test automation tools/frameworks (e.g. Appium, Calabash, UIAutomator, UI Automation, Robotium, etc…).  Ideally hands-on experience with Espresso or XCUITest, those are what we use here.
    • Willingness to work cross-functionally with other teams to make all products and deployments seamless for our customers.
    • Enthusiasm for your work and for new challenges in a young and successful startup.
    • Experience working closely with development and business teams.
    • Experience in an international company or remote team collaboration is a plus.
    • Fluent proficiency in English.

    You are a perfect fit, if you are passionate about software quality and security and if you always wanted to put a highly integrated system to the acid test. You are familiar with terms like unit tests, surface tests, integration tests, regression tests and load tests. You know when good is “good enough” and where to take a closer look.

     

    Perks

    What can we offer you?

    • The chance to bring in your own ideas
    • A strong team spirit
    • Excellent monetary benefits (a pension plan, a monthly mobility allowance for free taxi rides, subsidised public transport ticket)
    • Have your birthday off!
    • ...and all the usual start-up goodies like fruit, unlimited soft drinks, after-work beers, gym for free, a chill-out room with a massage chair, a foosball table and many more

     

    Oh, and the opportunity to work with the best team in the world (we know, everybody says so, but at FREE NOW it’s true)!

items.content:
TaxJar

QA Automation Engineer

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 20,000 businesses. Our core values * We do the right thing for our customers. * We're a team, built on trust. * We're proud to be remote. * We're in control of our own destiny. TaxJar’s remote-only team of 100+ people is growing quickly. We have an immediate opening for a QA Automation Engineer who wants to help us make ecommerce easier for everyone. We want you to join one of our product engineering teams and help us build a product our customers love. The product engineering team at TaxJar is solving complex problems on a daily basis, supporting our growing customer base and creating new solutions in a complex domain. We deal with large datasets, complex frequently-changing sales tax rules, and automating complex processes for thousands of business customers. *This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the US. As a QA Automation Engineer at TaxJar you will * Work with the Engineering team in developing a QA testing strategy for projects * Determining the appropriate balance of manual and automated tests, as well as the types of tests (UI, API, functional/performance/load, and so on) * Build end-to-end smoke tests * Create processes to validate data quality * Improve and build upon our test suite, test guidelines, and testing culture * Execute and report on the full test suite of our applications * Review and test your teammates pull requests REQUIREMENTS * 3+ years of Software Testing & Engineer experience * Advanced problem-solving, debugging and troubleshooting skills * Proven and demonstrable skill building end-to-end smoke tests * Experience working both Ruby and JavaScript test frameworks * A strong understanding of Ruby on Rails and RSpec * Ability to manage tasks from assignment through to production * Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player * Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment * Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc) You’ll be a great fit on our team if you * Have experience improving test suite performance * Can perform load testing for services at scale * Can document your morning routine using UML * Only want to work remotely * Are accountable for the code you deliver to production * Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration * Highly value working with people you like and respect * Are accountable * Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously * Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology. BENEFITS * Excellent health, vision and dental benefits * Flexible vacation policy * 401k Plan * $1,000 in professional development credit * Home office stipend * Equity in a profitable company * 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course) * Mandatory Birthday holiday! * 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave * Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more. We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for. If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

QA Automation Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: QA/Test Developer
Company: TaxJar | No office location

Technologies

qa

Job description

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 20,000 businesses.

Our core values

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 100+ people is growing quickly. We have an immediate opening for a QA Automation Engineer who wants to help us make ecommerce easier for everyone.

We want you to join one of our product engineering teams and help us build a product our customers love. The product engineering team at TaxJar is solving complex problems on a daily basis, supporting our growing customer base and creating new solutions in a complex domain. We deal with large datasets, complex frequently-changing sales tax rules, and automating complex processes for thousands of business customers.

*This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the US.

As a QA Automation Engineer at TaxJar you will

  • Work with the Engineering team in developing a QA testing strategy for projects
  • Determining the appropriate balance of manual and automated tests, as well as the types of tests (UI, API, functional/performance/load, and so on)
  • Build end-to-end smoke tests
  • Create processes to validate data quality
  • Improve and build upon our test suite, test guidelines, and testing culture
  • Execute and report on the full test suite of our applications
  • Review and test your teammates pull requests

REQUIREMENTS

  • 3+ years of Software Testing & Engineer experience
  • Advanced problem-solving, debugging and troubleshooting skills
  • Proven and demonstrable skill building end-to-end smoke tests
  • Experience working both Ruby and JavaScript test frameworks
  • A strong understanding of Ruby on Rails and RSpec
  • Ability to manage tasks from assignment through to production
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc)

You’ll be a great fit on our team if you

  • Have experience improving test suite performance
  • Can perform load testing for services at scale
  • Can document your morning routine using UML
  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are accountable for the code you deliver to production
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • 401k Plan
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

Apply now

About TaxJar

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and trusted by more than 15,000 businesses. We were founded to help eCommerce merchants spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. We're passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues.

items.content:
TEKsystems is in search of (1) Senior Application Security Penetration Testing Engineer to work fully REMOTE in an enterprise environment.
The Security Engineers will be responsible for the following:
  • Experience building test cases around RESTful APIs in an AngularJS/Spring environment
  • Executing existing and building new test cases for the 70 priority APIs.
  • PA focus should be observing their process and identifying near-term and long-term improvements (i.e. Threat Modeling, other AppSec techniques).
  • Automated tools experience is great, but the manual testing is biggest time commitment and where the client finds the higher end critical points found.
  • Performing static, dynamic and manual penetration testing
  • Sit in on design sessions
  • Documentation that corresponds on APIs
  • Engineer will look to find critical high findings, medium points to note, any recommendations of remediation work as necessary.
  • Veracode for static and dynamic testing, in POC with Rapid7 and Fortify but will need engineers that are strong in Veracode, Burp, and Zap
There will be a 1 step phone interview and the Engineer will be starting mid August 2019.

About TEKsystems:
We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call -3411 or email .com for other accommodation options.

items.title: QA Engineer - Vela Trading Systems, LLC - Antrim
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=13, c=15, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Overview

Vela is a leading independent provider of trading and market access technology for global multi-asset electronic trading. Our software enables clients to successfully execute on their trading strategies and manage risk across multiple fragmented markets, liquidity pools, and data sources. We help firms successfully differentiate and innovate in an ever-changing, increasingly-regulated and fiercely-competitive landscape, while also reducing total cost of ownership.

Vela’s ticker plant, execution gateways, trading platform, and risk and analytics software deliver a unique, ultra-low latency technology stack for electronic low-touch and Direct Market Access (DMA) execution and pricing. We leverage the latest innovations in technology to deliver cutting-edge performance, features, and reliability. Our modular stack is accessed through a single set of trading, data and risk APIs and can be delivered as-a-Service from multiple co-location data centers globally.

With access to more than 200 venues, Vela provides global coverage across all major asset classes. Clients are supported by an award-winning team of technical and business experts available 24x7 from our multiple offices in the US, Europe, and Asia. Vela’s clients include traders, market makers, brokers, banks, investment firms, exchanges, and other market participants.


Job Profile

At Vela Trading Systems we take pride in developing high quality solutions in a demanding and highly competitive industry. As a QA Engineer at Vela, you are on the critical front-line of upholding the standards of product quality and reliability that our customers demand.

As a Senior Vela QA Engineer, you are detail-oriented, thorough, and creative. You will mentor other team members and lead by example to uphold or raise the QA standard.

You work well with both local and remote teams, are a great communicator and take pride in helping build and improve our products and our customer’s user experience.

You will be part of a multi-disciplinary team that is responsible for the quality assurance of new product developments, feature enhancements, and maintenance updates across a range of components.

You will work closely with software developers and business analysts or experts to develop test strategies, test plans and test cases for both automated test execution and manual test execution.

You will maintain and extend automated testing frameworks and apply your creativity to leverage automation as much as possible.

You are already or will become a product and industry expert in key areas of the trading systems domain, and you will mentor other team members in the domain, products and QA processes.


Key Accountabilities


  • Contributing to the full test life-cycle, including analysis & design, implementation, test execution and release processes;
  • Management of tasks and projects to agreed deadlines;
  • Following direction from team-lead and achieving defined goals;
  • Developing knowledge of the trading systems domain and company products;
  • Work with cross-functional team members to advise and ensure appropriate QA occurs;
  • Strong client focus, with an emphasis on quality and stability in line with service level agreements.

Knowledge Skills & Experience Required

Essential:

  • 2–3 years’ experience in software engineering and/or quality assurance;
  • 2–3 years’ experience in software development and test automation;
  • Programming experience in C, C#, C++, Java or Python;
  • Experience with continuous integration / continuous delivery systems and processes;
  • Capital-markets and/or Financial Services knowledge (Trading, Market Data, protocols)
  • Experience in QA of user interface based, or API/programmatic based testing;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and organisational skills;
  • Degree in Computer Science, Software or Electrical Engineering or other related discipline; or a proven track record of QA and/or software development experience in a similar environment.

Desirable:

  • Cross-platform experience (Linux and Microsoft Windows);
  • Practical knowledge and experience in Agile Development and/or Testing Processes;
  • Experience and testing or development of financial, transactional or message-based systems;
  • Experience in test or development of message protocols FIX, FIXFAST, SBE or similar;
  • Ability to quickly analyse, learn and work with new complex systems.

Antrim

items.title: Quality Data Entry Specialist
items.content:
Quality Data Entry Specialist at UnitedHealth Group

Remote

Location: San Antonio Texas United States
Division:Local Care Delivery Shared Svc
Contest Number: 844147
Title: Quality Data Entry Specialist – Telecommute
Family: Medical and Clinical Operations
Function: Clinical Admin & Processing
Business Segment: OptumCare
Region: North America
Country: United States
City: San Antonio
State: Texas
Other States: Texas Texas Texas Colorado Michigan
Other Cities: Dallas Austin Houston Denver Detroit
Employee Status:Regular
Schedule:Full-time
Job Level:Individual Contributor
Shift:Day Job
Travel:No
Overtime Status:Non-exempt
Telecommuter Position: Yes

Position Description

Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that’s improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn’t about another gadget, it’s about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There’s no room for error. Join us and start doing your life’s best work.(sm)

The Quality Data Entry Specialist reviews medical records to abstract medical data to support HEDIS/STAR and OptumCare defined quality measures. This role will verify, update and maintain health related data per operational standard procedures. The primary focus of the role is to capture all supplemental data available in the Medical Record in order to achieve the highest STAR score possible.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Collects data in accordance with HEDIS technical specifications requirements for supplemental data collection
  • Review physician progress and encounter notes and identifies specific documentation related to HEDIS/STAR and OptumCare defined quality measures
  • Adheres to specific data entry requirements
  • Verifies patient level account data is acceptable by reviewing, correcting, transmitting, deleting, or reentering specified data
  • Participates in system changes, testing and system upgrades by inputting new data and reviewing output with application development teams
  • Maintains daily productivity standards
  • Faxes request for additional information when needed
  • Performs all other related duties as assigned

Required Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma or GED equivalent
  • 2+ years of data entry experience
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint
  • Medical terminology knowledge
  • HEDIS/STAR knowledge

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Certified Medical Assistant certification
  • 2+ years of experience in a physician’s clinic or hospital
  • Certified Professional Coder
  • Certified healthcare professional
  • Clinical work experience; specifically in primary care settings
Apply for job

About this job

Job description

Minimum Required Skills: Test Automation, Strong Selenium, experience with Maven and Java

Location: 100% Remote 

Time Zone: At least 6 hours overlap with PST

As a leading software development consultancy, Clevertech is building transformative enterprise solutions that are affecting millions of people and/or millions of dollars, while creating opportunities for growth for our developers.

We are seeking strong QA Automation Engineer with excellent communication skills to ensure our coding standards are maintained in code testing code. Experience with TestNG, Selenium, Maven and SureFire required.

There will be a 45-minute online technical test including Java, Selenium and Maven to advance.

Who You Are:

  • You are an experienced engineer with 2-5 years of Java Automation Testing
  • You can communicate clearly and precisely with developers and clients

Qualifications:

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

  • Flexible Schedules

  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
